title: VERIFY: Multi-Domain Dataset Grounding LTL in Contextual Natural Language
subtitle: Large-scale dataset linking LTL and Natural Language
description: VERIFY is the first large-scale, multi-domain dataset designed to bridge the gap between formal system specifications (LTL) and contextual natural language. It contains over 1.2 million rigorously generated triplets, each comprising an LTL formula, a structured Intermediate Technical Language (ITL) representation, and a domain-specific NL description. The dataset spans 13 diverse domains (e.g., finance, aerospace, medical devices). Data generation involved LTL enumeration/verification via model checking (Spot), mapping to ITL using a provably complete grammar, and LLM-driven NL generation (DeepSeek-R1), followed by extensive manual and automated validation (>99% estimated semantic correctness via Llama 3.3 judge). This dataset is intended to foster research in logic-to-language translation, formally-grounded NLP, domain adaptation, and human-centric verification. Please cite the original paper (details below) if you use this dataset in your research.

resources.description: Main dataset file containing LTL-ITL-NL triplets and associated metadata in CSV format.

fields.name: formula_id
fields.description: Unique identifier linking to the specific LTL formula structure.

fields.name: formula
fields.description: The raw LTL formula string (potentially non-canonical).

fields.name: latex
fields.description: LaTeX representation of the LTL formula.

fields.name: formula_canonical_form
fields.description: Canonical string representation of the LTL formula (derived from Spot).

fields.name: depth
fields.description: Structural depth of the LTL formula's abstract syntax tree.

fields.name: itl_id
fields.description: Identifier linking to the specific unique ITL structure/template.

fields.name: itl_text
fields.description: The corresponding Intermediate Technical Language (ITL) string.

fields.name: generation_method
fields.description: Method used to generate the ITL representation (e.g., 'rule-based').

fields.name: verified
fields.description: Whether the ITL representation's semantic equivalence to LTL was verified.

fields.name: is_correct
fields.description: Whether the ITL representation is considered correct based on validation checks.

fields.name: translation_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this specific translation instance.

fields.name: domain
fields.description: The application domain providing context (e.g., 'Aerospace', 'Financial Services').

fields.name: activity
fields.description: Natural language definitions of the propositional variables (e.g., p, q) used in the LTL formula for the given domain.

fields.name: translation
fields.description: The contextual Natural Language description corresponding to the LTL/ITL pair within the specified domain.

fields.name: generation_time
fields.description: Time taken (in seconds) for the generation pipeline steps for this record.
